theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA deletions mediated by direct repeats and their accumulation with age causing mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on accumulation of somatic mtDNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mtDNA mutation accumulation and resulting mitochondrial dysfunction driving systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutation accumulation in PolG mutator mice causing premature aging, highlighting mutation-driven aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutations and ROS vicious cycle causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mtDNA deletion mutations causing ETC abnormalities and apoptosis leading to sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mtDNA mutation accumulation as an aging clock causing mitochondrial dysfunction and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutations and ROS vicious cycle with impaired mitochondrial turnover contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced mtDNA damage accumulation impairing mitochondrial function and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains how mtDNA deletion mutations induce apoptosis and necrosis in skeletal muscle causing sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Electron Transport Chain Dysfunction and Complex I Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial complex I dysfunction and its role in aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Electron Transport Chain Dysfunction and Complex I Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how ETC gene knockdown modulates lifespan, implicating ETC dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Electron Transport Chain Dysfunction and Complex I Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage to mitochondrial proteins from ROS affecting ETC function and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Electron Transport Chain Dysfunction and Complex I Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial free radical theory emphasizing ROS accumulation damaging ETC and mitochondrial components.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Electron Transport Chain Dysfunction and Complex I Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic variants in nuclear-encoded mitochondrial genes affecting ETC and mitochondrial function influence longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Driven Inflammaging and ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS overproduction to activation of inflammatory pathways driving inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Driven Inflammaging and ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes adaptive mitochondrial ROS signaling (MARS) as a hormetic mechanism promoting longevity via signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Driven Inflammaging and ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction in aging muscle driven by sporadic denervation and ROS-mediated damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Proteostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial protein quality control mechanisms maintaining mitochondrial health and preventing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Proteostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial network dynamics and metabolic-epigenome axis regulating mitochondrial quality and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Proteostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes intracellular mtDNA evolution and quality control via fusion, fission, and mitophagy maintaining function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitofusin-Mediated Mitochondrial Structural Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related mitochondrial structural remodeling in skeletal muscle mediated by mitofusin proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitofusin-Mediated Mitochondrial Structural Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details loss of mitofusin 2 and mitochondrial dynamics causing structural changes and dysfunction in aging muscle.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Evolutionary Optimization and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes evolutionary optimization of mitochondria in hominids with compensatory mutations enhancing longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Evolutionary Optimization and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial protein import suppression triggering metabolic reprogramming and lifespan extension.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Evolutionary Optimization and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uncoupling to survive hypothesis linking mitochondrial uncoupling, reduced ROS, and altered metabolism to aging.
